pixi.core.ticker.Ticker

type
class
extends
pixi.interaction.EventEmitter
metadata
:native
"PIXI.ticker.Ticker"

Constructor

new()
A Ticker class that runs an update loop that other objects listen to. This class is composed around an EventEmitter object to add listeners meant for execution on the next requested animation frame. Animation frames are requested only when necessary, e.g. When the ticker is started and the emitter has listeners.

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

FPS : Int

The frames per second at which this ticker is running. The default is approximately 60 in most modern browsers. **Note:** This does not factor in the value of {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#speed}, which is specific to scaling {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#deltaTime}.

autoStart : Bool

Whether or not this ticker should invoke the method {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#start} automatically when a listener is added.

deltaTime : Float

Scalar time value from last frame to this frame. This value is capped by setting {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#minFPS} and is scaled with {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#speed}. **Note:** The cap may be exceeded by scaling.

elapsedMS : Float

Time elapsed in milliseconds from last frame to this frame. Opposed to what the scalar {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#deltaTime} is based, this value is neither capped nor scaled. If the platform supports DOMHighResTimeStamp, this value will have a precision of 1 µs.

lastTime : Float

The last time {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#update} was invoked. This value is also reset internally outside of invoking update, but only when a new animation frame is requested. If the platform supports DOMHighResTimeStamp, this value will have a precision of 1 µs.

minFPS : Int

Manages the maximum amount of milliseconds allowed to elapse between invoking {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#update}. This value is used to cap {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#deltaTime}, but does not effect the measured value of {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#FPS}. When setting this property it is clamped to a value between `0` and `PIXI.TARGET_FPMS * 1000`.

speed : Float

Factor of current {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#deltaTime}.

started : Bool

Whether or not this ticker has been started. `true` if {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#start} has been called. `false` if {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#stop} has been called. While `false`, this value may change to `true` in the event of {@link PIXI.ticker.Ticker#autoStart} being `true` and a listener is added.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

add(fn : Void -> Void, ?context : Void -> Void) : Ticker

parameters
fn {Function} The listener function to be added for updates
[context] {Function} The listener context
returns
{Ticker} this
Calls EventEmitter.on internally for the internal 'tick' event. It checks if the emitter has listeners, and if so it requests a new animation frame at this point.

addOnce(fn : Void -> Void, ?context : Void -> Void) : Ticker

parameters
fn {Function} The listener function to be added for one update
[context] {Function} The listener context
returns
{Ticker} this
Calls EventEmitter.once internally for the internal 'tick' event. It checks if the emitter has listeners, and if so it requests a new animation frame at this point.

remove(fn : Void -> Void, ?context : Void -> Void) : Ticker

parameters
[fn] {Function} The listener function to be removed
[context] {Function} The listener context to be removed
returns
{Ticker} this
Calls EventEmitter.off internally for 'tick' event. It checks if the emitter has listeners for 'tick' event. If it does, then it cancels the animation frame.

removeAllListeners(?event : String) : Void

inherited from pixi.interaction.EventEmitter
parameters
{String} event The event want to remove all listeners for.
Remove all listeners or only the listeners for the specified event.

removeListener(event : String, fn : EventTarget -> Void, ?once : Bool) : Void

inherited from pixi.interaction.EventEmitter
parameters
{String} event The event we want to remove.
{function} fn The listener that we need to find.
{Bool} once Only remove once listeners.
Remove event listeners.

start() : Void

Starts the ticker. If the ticker has listeners a new animation frame is requested at this point.

stop() : Void

Stops the ticker. If the ticker has requested an animation frame it is canceled at this point.

update(?currentTime : Float) : Void

parameters
[currentTime=performance.now()] {DOMHighResTimeStamp|number} the current time of execution
Triggers an update. An update entails setting the current elapsedMS, the current deltaTime, invoking all listeners with current deltaTime, and then finally setting lastTime with the value of currentTime that was provided. This method will be called automatically by animation frame callbacks if the ticker instance has been started and listeners are added.
